text: David Charles Olney (March 23, 1948 â€“ January 18, 2020) was an American folk singer-songwriter. He was born in Providence, Rhode Island. Olney performed as a solo singer-songwriter, and released more than 20 albums over forty years. He worked with artists such as John Hadley and Sergio Webb. His songs were covered by and co-written with Emmylou Harris, Steve Earle, Linda Ronstadt, Steve Young, Del McCoury, and Laurie Lewis, among others. Olney died of a heart attack during a performance onstage at the 30A Songwriter Festival in Santa Rosa Beach, Florida, on January 18, 2020, at age 71. ==References== ==Other websites== * Official web site * * * * * * Category:1948 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Deaths from myocardial infarction Category:American singer-songwriters Category:American folk singers Category:American folk musicians Category:American guitarists Category:Writers from Providence, Rhode Island Category:Singers from Rhode Island Category:Musicians from Rhode Island Category:Singers from Nashville, Tennessee Category:Musicians from Nashville, Tennessee Category:Writers from Nashville, Tennessee
title: David Olney
